alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown; Inland Georgetown (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 9:25PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Georgetown County through 1000 PM EDT... At 925 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oatland, or near Georgetown, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, DeBordieu Colony, Pawleys Island, Plantersville, Litchfield Beach and Georgetown Memorial Hospital. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern South Carolina.
